title:
Error analysis for discontinuous Galerkin time-stepping methods for
  nonlinear parabolic equations via maximal regularity
abstract:
We consider the discretization of a class of nonlinear parabolic equations by
discontinuous Galerkin time-stepping methods and establish a priori as well as
conditional a posteriori error estimates. Our approach is motivated by the
error analysis in [9] for Runge-Kutta methods for nonlinear parabolic
equations; in analogy to [9], the proofs are based on maximal regularity
properties of discontinuous Galerkin methods for non-autonomous linear
parabolic equations.
